CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 30, 1963, page 9 reads: "Conference - Karl Lutz (center) and Cal Cunningham (right) confer on the day's order. Cal learned the business of being a butcher and marketeer by watching Lutz in action.  Behind the case are veteran Lutz men Nap Jackson and Ezeel Frazier, who work together with all other members as a smooth team."  The author of the article was Toki S. Johnson, and described Calvin Cunningham working for Lutz' Meat Market on Centre Avenue since he was a boy and now manages the store when the owner, Carl Lutz, is away. Lutz Meat Market was located at 2145 Centre Avenue, at intersection of Elmore Street, Hill District. Calvin Cunningham died suddenly in 1969.
TitMainTitle: Interior of Lutz Meat Market, with Nat Jackson and Izzy Frazier behind counter, and owner Carl Lutz, and Calvin Cunningham holding papers in front of counter
